title: Fantastic service
body: I attended the equivalent of A and E Saturday pm following a slip on snow resulting in immense pain and loss of mobility in left arm/shoulder area. The receptionist was so friendly, polite and sympathetic and quickly got me signed in to wait. I didn‚Äôt have to wait long, and the nurse seeing me was so lovely - even got me some painkillers won her own initiative before trying to remove my jumper. Quick assessment followed by x ray showed I had broken my upper arm. They checked whether it was safe for me to go home and once that was confirmed with a follow up appointment at orthopaedics on Monday placed arm in a special sling, given lots of specific advice and even some codeine for the pain! What a super friendly, efficient and professional team they were, I couldn‚Äôt have asked for better. Top marks all round! This crucial hospital really needs to stay for North Yorkshire, it‚Äôs vital. Please support our NHS as much as you can and treasure the wonderful people we have working there.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: trying to cancel appointment
body: nearly 2 hours trying to cancel an appointment due to the weather each time after waiting several minutes phone went dead this happened 3 times asked for ext to breast clinic operator said they wont answer and she was right.  Managed to cancel it another way but was truly disgusted with St Margarets Hospital nearly 2 hours wasted trying to cancel appointment.

title: Horrible experience
body:
A horrific experience in a hospital. 
4 hours waiting at the urgent!! Care department. 
No staff. 
An absolute nightmare. The door was smashed only disabled door was working which made the room ice cold as was open nearly all the time.
I did not wait for my line I rather went to a different hospital.

title: Unprofessional and incompetent
body: Sent me to a walk-in clinic to have my X ray . My knees were painfull and I couldn‚Äôt drive. I got a taxi¬£20.00 each way . When I got there the clinic staff said that they had not been a walk in X-ray clinic for 2 YEARS !! And that the surgery should know this . I was furious. My knees were hurting and on top of that I shelled out ¬£40 on taxi fare.  I complained to the surgery and guess what ? All they could do was apologise. They refused to compensate me and an apology was not going to help me. Incidents like this have happened previously where the staff have made mistakes, been unprofessional and .. Useless that‚Äôs all I can say .

title: Very caring and attentive doctor
body: My father was admitted to the medical ward of the accident and emergency department having been seen by the most attentive and caring doctor I have ever met from A&E. The doctor dealt with my 81 year old father and I in the most respectful way. My father had a suspected blood clot on his lungs and the doctor made sure my father was dealt with as  quickly as possible and apologised for delays each time she came back to check on him. She explained everything that was going on, listened attentively to us and followed-up swiftly with other departments to ensure my father had the right people involved in his care.  The A&E department was heaving and the hospital was running out of space to put people but this doctor found a quieter area for us and moved my dad to the medical ward as soon as she could. Not once did she falter or change her temperament under such stressful conditions. My dad has now been moved to the Acute medical unit for closer care which the doctor rang me to tell me, as well as updating me on his progress. I am so pleased this young doctor was taking care of my dad, she is definitely in the right job! Thank you.

title: Best in Yorkshire
body: Been with this surgery for only a few years.  It is the best care i have ever received.   Reception staff so kind, doctors that listen and care about your health.  Building always clean.

title: Excellent service
body:
My wife was in critical care following a spinal operation   the support and medical assistance given was excellent from start to finish .
Clear information prior to operation and after , all staff were great the nurses doctors and all other staff were helpful and understanding at all times 
Thank you all

title: Everyone there very helpful
body: This has been my surgery for 70 years..in all that time I've seen many changes. However the overall service is good..during covid,extra pressure etc I've been treated politely and respectfully by all receptionists on phone. Using system online I've had phone calls within the time specified. Surgery pharmacist has replied to questions, and doctors and nurses have been most helpful..staff remain cheerful under trying circumstances..well done to you all.

title: Awful doctors
body:
I've been trying to get my 18 month old little girl some treatment for her bad skin for 4 months. I've been palmed off with every cream going yet even after multiple calls, no one would see her in person.
I have now moved gp surgery, the day she went on their system... within an hour of my call, I'd spoken to a gp and been invited in so they could see my little girl. She has now been given a treatment plan and a follow up face to face appointment. This has taken an HOUR... 1 hour! Yet 4 MONTHS on and Garden City Surgery have left my 18 month old to suffer

title: Fantastic staff
body: I attended the neurological department twice and each time the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful and overall very professional. They are a credit to the department and made my visit so less daunting. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: York Teaching Hospital NHS foundation Trust

title: Left me in tears
body:
My 84 year old father was return firstly to my 80 year old mother after falling and hitting his head on both the marble mantel, then on the wrought iron surround of their fire place with 14 stitches in his head, at 4am. 
Then 6 months later returned with a pelvis cracked in 2 places and thinkinging he'd been to work- they didn't know he'd fractured his pelvis until 2 days later because my elderly mother couldn't lift him out of his chair for him to go to toilet. 
This hospital is a disgrace! There are some very kind people in it but the senior  management  have completely lost their way. 
I'm so scared for my father - they have 2 Zimmer frames between 6 of them but no nurses to help them walk again.  Then they wonder why there are no beds in hospitals. An absolute disgrace!!!

title: Excellent practice
body:
I attended urgent care centre on a saturday evening 19/2/22 it was very busy and the staff were working extremely hard. 
I would just like to thank the nurse who seen me for her kindness, compassion and professionalism. She made me feel very comfortable and relaxed about an embarrassing scenario and is a credit to the nhs

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad practice
body: I had appointment at 1025am I turned up stood waiting at the desk then finally some one came I told her who I was she looked on computer then told me I was late but not by my watch,I was then told I was not going to be seen if I wanted to be seen I had to return in the afternoon,had someone been on the desk this would not occur. Then on my records I find they have put I did not attend that was not true I was refused to be seen.

title: Top notch care
body:
Following a minor opp at my local hospital in Darlington, I needed to have dressings changed daily. After speaking to reception I was quickly seen by the healthcare staff, full details of what had been done we‚Äôre taken. Not only did the staff clean and repack the wound, but they made sure that the care that I needed for the duration of my holiday was all put in place... 
I cannot thank the staff enough for the outstanding care that I received..

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very helpful staffs
body: From the appointment set up to my visit and further followup, Francis road medical centre has been outstanding. Thank you for help with my health screening.

title: Dreadful
body: My 2 yo had day surgery at Kidderminster. They were first class and amazing. They gave a number to ring at Worcester hospital if there were complications within the first 24h. I noticed some complications within this time so rang the number as it was a weekend. The Worcester hospital said there was nothing they could do and to call 111. I did this at 2.30pm and was told I would get a call back as soon as someone was available. It wasn't until 10 hours later, after midnight that they rang and dismissed the case and left us without help. They just don't care about you. I will be trying to keep my child well enough to see a my GP on Monday. Don't bother ringing. They are horrible.

title: Great practice
body:
My elderly father uses your practice, and as I have authority to deal with his medical issues I now and again contact you on his behalf.
I am so impressed with the speed that you reply to my online requests. Even though recently I stated the concern was not urgent I received a reply that a Dr would phone my dad that morning. Within 45 minutes he received the call and an item was added to his repeat prescription. I use a different surgery and the last time I requested a non urgent telephone appointment I had to wait 3 weeks. It is almost impossible to see a Doctor where I live. My husband was given an appointment at the Woking Community Hospital for a blood test as our surgery was not doing them. I hope the Ottershaw residents appreciate how lucky they are.
Thank you for making everything so much easier for me to assist my dad.

title: good attention
body: thank you for fast diagnosis of my issue  and treatment started the same week   ,, and all explained the treatment i going to receive thank you

title: So grateful.
body: I can not thank the amazing epac staff some AnE staff and the gynecology staff that helped me the night off 19/2/22. They were and have been amazing and  supportive and really saved me to be honest. I can not thank them enough and think they are incredible at what they do. The nhs should be proud üëè.

title: Colonoscopy
body:
Had my colonoscopy here and felt very anxious but the staff made me feel relaxed from the very beginning and made time to talk me through ever part of the process, absolutely amazing staff  there and cannot praise them enough!!!
A massive thankyou toall the staff from me

Richard

title: Great staff
body:
Very speedy and professional immediate service.
My mum was treated with great respect, all investigations were carried out promptly and we were kept updated throughout.
The only negative was that the Dr said she had suffered a 'faint' I wouldn't have put her through all that if that is what it was. He should have chosen his words more carefully.
Due to the size of the department we would moved from cubicle to corridor, to another corridor, back to a cubicle.....slightly disconcerting.
Overall, the staff were amazing.
My mum was eventually diagnosed with things we were unaware of and admitted to the correct department (it wasn't a faint!)

title: Poor experience
body: My elderly father with copd, emphysema, high blood pressure had a bad fall outside at 9.45pm. He was taken to hospital with a wound to his head, he banged it badly, a broken thumb and other cuts and bruises. I took my panicking mother to the hospital following the ambulance and we were left to wait in an outside area, minus degrees, my mum is 80, as we were not allowed in. I explained how my father would panic, last time he was there he nearly died from a lung infection and my brother died from a heart attack at 45, so he panics at the hospital, but still told to go home. We were allowed to see him for 5 mins in the ambulance before then, so I insisted they take my number and must call me if they decide he can go home, I would collect him anytime. They lost the number, told him to go at 3.20am, still minus degrees, we had his coat as it was covered in blood, and they told us to take it. He had to ring a taxi and go home alone. Its just not good enough, I appreciate the trust is under pressure, but I would have cared for him, taking pressure from the staff, whilst the Doctor saw him and then I would have taken him home. I cannot understand why we weren't allowed in, I would have happily done a lateral flow right then. However, covid was not the reason I was given for not being allowed in anyway.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor service
body:
I feel compelled to leave this review after several really poor experiences at this surgery. The reception staff are unhelpful and show little compassion, unbelievable when they are there to help people who are poorly. It‚Äôs quite hit & miss with the nursing staff, some are great but others make you feel you are an interruption to their day.
I think what is most telling about the surgery is their lack of response to the very small number of reviews  left on this site, it shows how little they care about how their patients feel. I acknowledge this reflects on the management, the actual Doctors I have dealt with have been fine.

title: B5 ward needs health and safety review asap
body: I was sent from gp to b5 ward for an emergency scan, I was struggling to walk and  was in a lot of pain. My gp requested they scan my ovaries due to my history of polycystic ovaries. I was sat in a waiting room for 4 hours, had blood tests, urine tests and swabs done. I was told I would be scanned of the tests came back clear.  I was sent into a room for an internal investigation the bed still had a sheet on it from the person who was done before me. There was blood on the sheets, the doctor saw it and ripped it off the bed then threw the blood covered kitchen towel on the floor in the corner. I was eventually told my tests were clear and instead of booking my scan I was sent home with antibiotics, even though there was no signs of infection in my tests. I'm still in a lot of pain and even after ringing back up the staff want me to wait to see if the antibiotics work. They went against the recommendation of my doctor and have left me in pain and still unable to walk. During my 4 hours I also requested painkillers several times, they would say yes we will get you some but would never return.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worse hospital ever
body: I get there is a covid out break so I want no excuses on this one. I came into surgery on the 18th at the Sunderland ward. I have previous pstd from this hospital after causing a blood clot and previous stressful child births experiences. I got to the door and was told my partner wasn't allowed in. I broke down as I was having a panic attack. I didn't realise how much I couldn't handle until then with my previous experiences. It said on the letter you was allowed one person. But obviously your not. They allowed my husband in a side box room with me. The nurses and Dr's came in and did the ops and check overs and I told them why I was crying and sad. No one gave a care. I held onto my partner as I was so frightened. I got told i was next and had to leave my partner. I had to wait 50 mins for my op. It was the afternoon. I was 4th on the list. I was a type 1 diabetic. There is no communication between the staff. The anesthetic Dr tried to put me higher on the list. Not sure what happened. After the op and back in the bay I asked for my husband. I quickly ate and drank and was sick and then quickly got dressed and went a loo and went and sat in the waiting area with my husband. I was really poorly. I was sick again and put back in the bay on a bed. I asked when I could be discharged. They informed me I could discharge myself. But no I had to wait as I need blood thinning meds. I did see other people on the ward with other patients. But because they were woman it was okay. But me it wasn't. I suffered terribly in the hands of the NHS. Mentally and physically. I would never have an op there again it's disgusting and staff don't communicate. I was stressed out. Which I didn't need with an op. No care or companssion and medical treatment is awful.

title: Excellent care
body: Very friendly staff , every stage of treatment explained could not have had better care .Would recommend this department to anyone needing tests and treatment .

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great hospital
body: I would just like to say my stay in this hospital was great staff were so kind and told me every thing that was going to happen

title: Impossible to communicate with once again ....???
body:
Good Morning - I have tried to arrange my online prescription as I have for the last 15years or so.
I understand the world is changing we all understand that ... But have some feeling for those that need your support and provide clear and useable instructions ... the migration to your new online prescription service is awful ... try it from the outside ... its NOT working and you don't provide any contact details to allow anyone to ask for HELP??
So this is the response .... what do you expect??
We all praise the NHS across the board ... So please don't hide behind the service we all praise.
I'm not a computer wizard but not unable to work out processes, BUT this exercise to move to a New Online Service is sadly not well prepared ... I'm short of medication and this transition makes me nervous to be able to obtain my medication ....as the old way is turned off ... WHY??
Sorry NOT impressed and I think we have been here before College Way.

title: Proffesionaly Run
body:
I am new ro the surgery, I was treated respectfully by front line staff and had personal call from G P 
 Yet to meet G P face to face but xcellent service so far.

title: Distressing
body:
I was taken by ambulance with chest pains to whiston at 3am. The paramedics were amazing and stayed with me in the corridor the whole time. I was on a bed in a corridor for 1.5 hours, which was totally fine and I felt safe and looked after.
At 4.30am, Following a satisfactory ecg a nurse informed me I now had to sit in the waiting room for test results.
I was scared, alone, felt terrible and explained I can‚Äôt sit upright or walk far without passing out and could I lie down here to wait. I was rudely told no and with no discussions taken to wait room.
I was in the waiting room alone for 3 hours feeling like I was going to pass out, at 7.30am I enquired at reception desk if they knew how much longer my tests results would be as it had been 4 hours, to be told the dr wasn‚Äôt arriving until 8am and the wait time was considerable (potentially 11 hours).
I understand our nhs is stretched, over worked and under paid, the staff do their best, but the patients in a&e are scared, vulnerable and I personally was terrified and feeling the worst in my life. To be told I had been left alone with chest pains in a waiting room for 3 hours when the dr wasn‚Äôt even on site was so upsetting.
If I had been left in the corridor lying down I would have better, I felt abandoned, no communication, no follow up to see how I feeling, like I really didn‚Äôt matter.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Tansley ward
body: My stay on tansley ward was not positive I was made to feel I was wasting there time although I‚Äôd been sectioned also the ward was run by some very lazy nurses although not all the nurses, they were too busy to chat with you , and there were time wasters regarding patients who really should not have been on the ward at all, as they were constantly taking drugs and drinking

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible surgery
body: If I could go back in time I would have never registered at this surgery even if I had to travel to another city? Why? Because they do not take a patient centred approach, they hardly actually listen to the patients symptoms and they will rush you out of the surgery within minutes.

title: Very Poor Service
body: I need to have my hearing aid repaired. Im trying to contact the service since two months and have spoken to 4 different member of staff. Each time i get a new story. Im a pensioner and really need my NHS hearing aid repaired so I can speak to my grand daughter over the telephone. MEDISCAN has given me such a poor service.  No doubt that CQC has given them INADEQUATE rating, the NHS should consider something about the patients whom are still under care of this company. I have seen other reviews about the company and it seems im not the only one effected.

title: My recovery coach is amazing
body: I've been with the Central Wandsworth cmht for many years and only till recently did I receive support from a recovery coach. She is so understanding to what I'm going through and support me with my issues. I feel for once someone actually understands what I am going through and I am able to call her when I'm struggling. The fact she also has mental health issues means that she is able to understand the things I go through.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: Fantastic
body:
The therapist I was paired with was incredible. She listened and understood everything I said and did her best to tailor the service to my needs. I never once felt like she was just ticking boxes for the sessions to count. 

My time with her has changed my life in such a meaningful way. 
I‚Äôm so thankful to her and everyone else I met at the practice.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic work
body: Im so happy the way my brother was treated here.  .i had a call .family friend saying my brother was ther and very porly.  So i immediately spoke with nurses voa telephone as 300mile away. So i needed to see my brother . Respecting the restrict rules on the covid 1 covid19 and the chances of my brother pulling through were so slim. His lovely doctor and nurss dis all they could srruggling to find the causes but. Short of a miracle.  He was a lucky mqn. Because they fought so hard with him and 7a to help and save him. And now. Hes on the mend. And safe.  But i c.c.u were amazing . The focus and the work they do . Really shone through . I thamked them in person and i will now leave a review and also. Thank D4 urology for his after care and helping get to a plave where he can now have care at home. He is doing so so qell i cant thank them enough.  Donations to the ward will be made from our family.  We have our brother back ... üôèüëå

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: I received a reminder for renewal of medication‚Ä¶
body: I have been with this practice for 30 years and I have found all gp's and nurses,as well as reception staff to be exellent in their care, they have always been able to answer queries on my medication, helped me with ordering and reordering my medication and getting me appointments or a phone call during the past 2 years or more during this pandemic. I think all of them deserve to not only be thanked for their work, but to be paid  a wage in comparison to what they actually do, so I can only thank them myself.

title: Best practice ever!
body: I moved into the area from the dewsbury area and the quality of care  in this practice has been nothing of phenomenol. The receptionists are friendly and the doctors have great knowledge. They have supported me in dealing with me our long health issues and have been fantastic. Have finally found the right practice !

title: Best surgery in Beeston.
body: I can't praise everyone at this practise enough from Reception staff to nurses and doctors, they have gone above and beyond to help their patients and especially during the pandemic. A practice that makes everyone feel safe and cared for and treated with dignity and respect.  Many thanks to you all.

title: Terrible reception service
body: When to the reception to had in a PCR test for a procedure later in the week as requested in the admittance letter.  Instructions were to leave the test at microbiology reception. After 45 minutes, talking to several people in person and on the phone, NOT ONE OF THEM could tell me where to drop the PCR test off and I was even laughed at because I got upset. Disgraceful!

title: Lovely Team
body:
I visited today with my 3 year old boy who had injured his wrist. We went to A&E and were taken round to ANP where we were seen immediately, X Rayed 10 minutes later and then back into ANP for a splint and advice on next steps.

All of the staff were lovely and great with my son so I wanted to say thanks for a very reassuring and stress free experience

readBy.name: Harrogate and District NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful Practice.
body: Will be changing practice ASAP. Constantly being belittled, upset by staff, talked down to (especially by the reception staff). The doctors at this practice all seem to have different ideas of care and disagree with eachother - I get no proper care or answers to any of my queries. The level of care is awful. I'm not the only person with unpleasant experiences here - you should REALLY look into this issue.

title: In my opinion this is a very good practice
body: I have had to contact the surgery twice and was sent a prescription electronically to my chemst very promptly. i have had a "face to face" wth GP also a follow up appointment.

title: A&E  RUBBISH
body: Left on a small bed for 16 hours. NEVER offered a drink or food we had to ask. Talk about dehydration. Had a chest x-ray and blood done. Bed was moved to a very noisy area behind A&E, 20 minutes sleep in 24 hours, not good. Clinical procedures carried out according to manuals. No empathy or care given. Can't say I'm impressed. No explanations given, I suggested if no beds send me home. They couldn't get rid of me quick enough. Only said ring 999 if things get worse. Still they've hit their targets and that is all that matters to staff.

title: Worst Doctor‚Äôs Surgery, including out of house‚Ä¶
body: Besides not actually visiting the surgery, waiting over an hour on the phone to make an appointment only to be given an out of hours appointment for a Sunday - then never getting that call - it now means I have to wait to even try to get through on the phone and, IF I succeed, wait another hour or so to speak to the receptionist to attempt to get another appointment, probably yet another out of hours as per the last 2! Why can‚Äôt I get to speak to my doctor? Is that too much to ask for?

title: Amazing, Friendly and Speedy Service
body:
I am visiting from Kent and had to take my daughter to A&E with a suspected broken foot. 
Upon arrival I found the reception staff at the main A&E and Paediatric A&E to be really friendly and helpful. Following this we were quickly seen by caring Sister and Nurse and then with literally no waiting time were booked for an X-ray. There was no reception open at X-Ray but those in the department responded quickly and helpfully. My daughters X-Ray was completed in minutes and then we were back to A&E. Within 15 minutes we were called in to discuss the injury with another smiling, friendly nurse who then reviewed the X-Ray with a consultant and quickly informed us that all was good. 
Overall this experience lasted less than 1 1/2 hours. Which is amazing!! 
At my local A&E this would normally be 4-5 hours. 
Thank you all so much, my daughter is 14 and said that this was an amazing experience and everyone was lovely. I totally agree.

Thank you, you lovely people.

title: Rapid, personal and professional service
body: The NHS at it‚Äôs best! Contacted GP on Monday, referred to rapid access Dermatology clinic, receptionist phoned Tuesday with a cancellation, seen Wednesday morning. Reassured. Summary letter received 8 days later. Thank you!

title: NHS at best!
body:
The NHS at it‚Äôs best! Contacted GP on Monday, referred to rapid access Dermatology clinic, receptionist phoned Tuesday with a cancellation, seen Wednesday morning. Reassured. Summary letter received 8 days later. Thank you! 
Thanks also for the outstanding and responsive care the whole practice gave my husband and me whilst he was being looked after and dying at home in October

title: Can never get an appointment
body: Even before Covid its been difficult to get an appointment with a dr, any dr. All too frequently I give up even trying to get a phone consult with my dr. My issues are fairly complex and there's info 'lost in translation' when speaking to another dr. To be fair to the doctors they are very overworked and Covid hasn't helped. However,  there's almost never any follow-through or follow up now so problems I've been bringing up for months don't progress, and in fact have become worse. Can't access on-line appt requests now at all which means trying to call for a consult or appointment which is next to useless. I've even gone to the practice trying that route and again that didn't work. Its very frustrating and discouraging especially since a few years ago it wasn't like this.  Previously I would get a call after a referral to see if it had been successful or if something else was needed. If my blood work was out of balance I would get a call that day telling me to go to A&E for a 'top up' or to be aware of how it might affect me.  There seems to be a faster change over in doctors as well than previously. Maybe that's the nature of the beast but its not working for the patients. The Lawson Practice used to be great, now its just frustrating and occasionally counterproductive.

title: Travel Immunisation Service
body:
Your website says that you‚Äôre not offering this service ‚Äòdue to Covid‚Äô but is this service likely to ever be resumed? Does this also apply to pre-school boosters, MMR,  tetanus etc? 

Furthermore, patients need clearer signposting from your surgery to find our what immunisation protection we already have (need to be given the records) and where we should go for them. 
Some vaccinations required for travel are free on the NHS. Making it hard to patients to get these vaccinations and to pay for those that should be free, could lead to people not getting the protection and falling ill as a consequence.

title: Excellent treatment
body: I was treated in the Pain Management Dept at the hospital.  From the minute I entered the Department until the time I was discharged the staff including the consultant were wonderful.    They were reassuring all the time and even though I have been treated here before this visit  was a first class experience.   Thank you NHS üåà

title: Poor attitude and bed side manner
body:
Attended the walk in centre on 17.3.22 at 2030 hrs. The insistence on patients being there alone was inhuman. The staff were so intent on telling me I couldn't be there with my 19 year old son to the point of disinterest in the patient. Another patient, with appendicitis came in just after us, in extreme pain, barely conscious and incoherent, left in the waiting room and then treatment room alone. It went against every fibre of decency to allow this to happen, so I looked after her until her parent could be there.
It's a shame that the medical care provided was so over shadowed by this abrupt and uncaring manner evident across the staffing.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: My wife attended this practice today with a suspected broken toe. The staff were very professional and speedy. Within 1 hour my wife had been seen by a nurse, X rayed, diagnosed and bandaged!! Cannot be faulted at all!!

title: Pit Stop/Redbrook Ward
body: Excellent staff in Pit Stop who dealt with my husband straight away, along with Out Patient Plasterers and XRay Team.

title: Communication Breakdown
body: Since my last visit I haven't been able to see Dr at surgery only telephone consultation after hanging on and on telephone to get this far.  Currently needing a review  but would really like to see Dr face to face.

title: Amazing work
body:
I could not believe the differance it made for such a pailess and quick operation, and not having to wear glasses for 65 years.
I cannot what to have my other eye done.

title: terrible administration
body: phoned about my elderly mother and a rather rude woman said i was abusive when i asked her how was i supposed to know my mums nhs number! (i don't even know my own). Also, as she was apparently "not on the system" she does not exist. Whilst nurses and paramedics are great the administrators are most certainly not.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Need to work in digital format
body: This surgery is still old fasioned ! They need to get the kiosk working again! They need to make sure they are more digital ! Its 2022 why are we still having lettera by post ???? We need emailed letters lyk other service we need text messages sent as soon as an appointment has been booked !!! The managers definitly need some digitial input into the surgery!

title: Pointless system
body: 111 booked me an appointment for 2pm for urgent care, hours later was still waiting. Was told by receptionist that the appointments don't mean anything and would have been better off coming in as a walk in patient. Why are we being told to call 111 to ease the nhs if it's going to delay us getting treatment. Do not recommend this urgent care

title: Amazing Staff
body:
The Doctors and all of the staff at Terrington Surgery truly are remarkable and I simply cannot praise them enough.
During the past, very tough couple of years due to the pandemic, I have never once found it difficult to obtain prompt medical advice, either by a same day telephone call with a doctor or by way of a face to face appointment with a doctor or nurse, I have also always found that ordering repeat prescriptions to be easy by way of ordering online or over the telephone.
Whenever I have had cause to visit the surgery I have noticed  the staff to be practically 'rushed off their feet' but they have always found the time to speak to me about my needs in a friendly, polite and professional manner and have always dealt with my medical problems very thoroughly and on a couple of occasions have gone above and beyond to ensure that I have received the prompt medical help that I needed at the time.
I feel extremely lucky to be a patient of Terrington Surgery, many of my family and friends, who are registered with other practices in the Ryedale area, do not have the same excellent medical care which I receive, many of them are having to wait more than two weeks for a face to face appointment or a telephone call from their Doctor including my 80 year old mum who has several complex and painful medical conditions.
I would like to say a very big thank you to every single one of the staff at Terrington Surgery and please please keep up your excellent work!

title: Great experience
body:
From the moment I arrived at 7am on the Saturday to when I was discharged on the Sunday everything was excellent. From the facilities, the Nurses, catering and the doctors all were 1st class. Couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. 

Would recommend to all family and friends. The staff work long hours and still manage to have a smile everytime they speak to you. 

Keep up the excellent work Woodlands 

Thanks 
Richard

title: Caring, concerned and compassionate
body:
Being aware of the pressure the surgery staff are under due to Covid I was reluctant to make an appointment.  However, due to various health issues it became necessary to bite the bullet and arrange to see my   GP recently.  I went with a written list of concerns finding it easy to forget important details in the time allocated for appointments.  I came away feeling listened to, understood, reassured and pleased with what was achieved, which included an urgent hospital referral, a COPD review and a letter chasing up an overdue appointment with a Dietician. We covered the concerns on my list and nothing was overlooked. 

I should add here that the NHS have been remarkable too, with two procedures arranged within the next eight days.  

  I have been with Alma Road Surgery for many years and have always found their receptionists very helpful, friendly and accommodating.  Same with the healthcare nurses, the dispensary staff and the phlebotomists.  I've also met several of the doctors when my own GP has not been available, and have always been treated with respect.  

I have nothing but praise for Alma Road Surgery, and would like to thank all the staff for their caring, concern and compassion.

title: Ae2,mhd,general surgery,and ward 44
body: Staff everywhere made you relaxed and at ease,everyone from start of my visit to the discharge have made me see how hard it is to work in the hospital environment. The Victoria staff work long hours, there is very high standards which all staff work to, I would also like to thank catering for the variety of excellent meals provided ,also a special mention to all the staff at ward 44 for their dedication to short and long term patients and to see staff keep on working if a member of staff was off due to leave.also getting bloods from me was more harrowing for them than me, but they brought in the phlebotomist no3 and  she succeeded. I'm now due a follow up procedure in the next week, unfortunately as an outpatient. I will return with more individually wrapped treats as the night shift lost out with me being discharged. Again top marks

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing teamwork & positive attitude
body:
The team at Maidstone gave me excellent care. 

It was extremely busy; they were efficient, patient, calm & polite. I particularly liked to see the respect shown to elderly patients. Keep up the good work !

title: Poor communication. Rude staff member
body: I had a problem with one administration staff member, and following a second issue with the same person, I decided to make a written complaint. I sent this to PALS last Saturday but as yet have not even received any acknowledgement. I know covid is blamed for every issue in the NHS but this is still very poor. I followed up the written complaint with calls to voicemail but these too go unresponded to.  I then wrote to the CEO of the hospital but again no reply. A timely acknowledgement or telephone called is surely not much to ask?

title: Great practice
body: I consulted with Penrhyn Surgery several times over the last year, for various different issue. The doctor and secretaries have been excellent: supportive, attentive, caring, dedicated and prompt. I could not recommend them more.

title: Excellent
body: Absolutely wonderful service. Seen very quickly, staff were marvellous, so friendly and warm. I couldn't have asked for better. Thank you all so much

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing service
body:
I am truly blessed to be able to get such services. I was extremely scared and horrified by my situation and I received such an amazing help from the staff. I got everything delivered at home and the process just took 2 days. It was super quick and effective. I can‚Äôt thank you guys enough for this support.
Thank you so much!

title: Thanks
body:
Today I visited with my 96yr old mum (Marian Rix) who had problems with a swollen ankle.
Please convey my thanks to all who were involved in her care and for their kindness. 
In view of the pressures you are are all working under it makes me doubly grateful for all that you have done today.

title: Excellent treatment
body: I was very impressed with the treatment I received at the Chelmsford unit. All members of staff were very helpful and efficient, both on the assessment and  proceedure visits. I would thoroughly recommend SpaMedica to any one needing the removal of a cataract.

title: Brilliant service
body: Attended on Saturday ENT following a 2 week urgent referral to special clinic seeing 200 people for rapid cancer diagnosis, the staff were lovely, friendly chatting and putting people at ease.  Consultant was the most efficient I‚Äôve seen in years, explaining my condition and giving advice, listen to my concerns resolved my fears and thankfully excluded cancer, then went on to give me lots of advice for my needs and made useful onward referrals for me.  I am so grateful for the NHS and the fabulous people that work within it.  Thank you

title: Lack of communication is a major problem
body: 83 year old mother taken in earlier today (by ambulance) with extremely low heart beat (40) and Covid. Have phoned 5 times in the last 6 hours, only got through to A&E once (cut of the rest of the time) and when I did get through, they were waiting for test results. My partner & I both have Covid, so we can't go to the hospital to get an update. We really don't know if things are ok or there is a major issue. My father was taken in 15 months ago and we were told he was ok, until we got a call saying we needed to visit him and he died the following morning. It really is time you figured out a way of tagging certain internal updates that you must be maintaining, so that relatives can access this, with the relevant security, remotely therefore communicating better without additional admin for the staff.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: No call back
body: Daughter has been unwell over the weekend with temp reaching 39, unsteady on her feet not eating or drinking. Was told she needed to be seen and would receive a call back. 2 hours later no call back. I phoned at 4pm it‚Äôs currently 630pm. Been waiting to get back through for 40 minutes. I understand the service is busy but when I‚Äôm told my daughters symptoms are serious enough to warrant her to be seen I expect a call back promptly not 2 hours later and counting !! Oh and btw she‚Äôs only 13 months !! Babies and toddlers should be viewed as priority !!!!

author: lotiondp46
title: Trouble with telephone calls.
body:
I am over 95 years of age.  
I have rang the surgery multiple times recently. Each time I waited patiently for my call number ranging from call number 17 to call number 7.  
Each time when I was number 1 my call was cut off and I had to begin again.  
I cannot attend the surgery and simply wished to report my monthly Blood Pressure readings.

author: Femyz37
title: Gynaecology - Maternity Wing LCH
body:
This was my third appointment with the gynaecologist. Each has been cold and impersonal. The ward it‚Äôs self is not a pleasant place to be and each gynaecologist I‚Äôve seen I feel has lacked any interest in my thoughts, feelings or concerns.  
Yesterday‚Äôs appointment was over an hour late but no one took the time to inform me nor politely apologise for the wait.  
I must say the nurses are warm and caring. But the overall experience, I think, would put many women off seeking help or treatment.  
I felt quiet upset after yesterday‚Äôs appointment. I may look to go private which I think is unacceptable.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

links.id: show an interest in why the patient is there
be up to date on the service a patient

author: Wren3427
title: Good inpatient stay with some concerns
body:
I was admitted to RVH in July 2021. I had developed blurred vision in both eyes and after seeing my optician she referred me to eye casualty.  
I was admitted to the short stay ward where I had an unsuccessful lumbar puncture and needed to have an xray guided one. Initially the consultant thought I had idiopathic intracranial hypertension but my csf pressure was normal but showed high levels of white cells and raised proteins.  
I was admitted to ward 4E neurology after a CT chest, abdomen and pelvis showed I had a large amount of enlarged lymph nodes in my chest and needed a biopsy to determine if I had lymphoma or sarcoidosis. My vision remained very poor and I was assessed each day by ophthalmology. I also had chest x-rays, a cardiac echo, pulmonary function tests, daily bloods, 2 weeks of intravenous antibiotics as I had positive blood cultures.  
I also needed a full body MRI but I needed surgery to remove my spinal cord stimulator as it has metal in it and was not compatible with the MRI scanner. After 6 weeks I was finally diagnosed with neurosarcoidosis and pulmonary sarcoidosis after a biopsy was taken of my lymph nodes and I was treated with IV steroids. I was finally discharged after almost 7 weeks.  
I certainly could not complain about my care or treatment from any department. The nursing staff were excellent as were the doctors and health care assistants. The domestic staff were constantly cleaning and the standard of cleanliness of the environment was extremely high. All staff were friendly.  
I did find that some of the nurses did not understand what I and other patients were saying. However some of them had not been in Northern Ireland for very long, and their knowledge and understanding of the language would improve with time. This did not interfere with their quality of care.  
I had to retire when I was 45 from a back injury and I was a registered nurse for 25 years, my last post as a band 7 ward manager for 10 years. I was very impressed with the standards in ward 4E, from all the staff, the information available about weekly audits on hand hygiene, environmental audits, falls and pressure sores which are standard audits in all wards in all hospital trusts in Northern Ireland.  
There was a high usage of agency staff who were block bookings and their standard of care was also high. I certainly understand the need for using agency staff due to the unrelenting shortage of registered nurses in northern Ireland.  
There were two band 6 deputy sisters on the ward but no band 7 ward manager/sister visible the entirety of my stay. There was a band 7 sister for the first 3 weeks but unfortunately she never introduced herself to any patients and did not appear to be ward based at all.  
As an ex-ward manager I think it is extremely important for the ward lead to be visible and accessible. I know I certainly introduced myself to patients and ensured I spoke to every patient each day if only for a few minutes.  
During my stay visiting was reduced to one visit for one hour per week from a relative. I didn't find this to be a problem at the beginning as I felt too unwell to care but could see how much it distressed elderly patients. This could not be helped due to covid and staff spent time with those patients when time allowed.  
The main dislike I had was being moved from bay to bay during my stay. I understand staff were trying to keep bays with more independent patients together. However on one occasion I was moved to an all male bay. I was not asked if I consented or even minded being moved to an all male bay and I did mind. I don't think mixed sex bays are appropriate especially when the patient next to me was detoxing from alcohol and was extremely confused.  
The only issue with staff that I had during my entire stay was on the day I was moved to an all male bay. I informed the nurse looking after my bay that I was going to meet my parents and daughter to exchange dirty clothes for clean clothes and to see my father as he had just been diagnosed with lung cancer. I was off the ward approximately 20 minutes when the health care assistant came looking for me, to tell me a porter had arrived to take me for a procedure which I had no knowledge of being scheduled. I informed him that they had my mobile number if they needed to contact me.  
I only got 5 minutes to spend with my family and returned to the ward. When I arrived I asked the nurse what test I was going for and they informed me that they just told me that to get me to come back to the ward. I was extremely upset about being lied to because at this stage I still had no diagnosis and any test was welcomed by me if I thought it would get me closer to a diagnosis. This upset me terribly and I ended up in tears.  
No patient should be told lies. I told the nurse that it was a despicable thing to do and the registrar who was on call was extremely angry when he found me in tears when he came to examine me. I could have put in a complaint but decided against it as the rest of my stay was good and I didn't want one incident to mar my high opinion of the rest of the staff.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: JMcL
title: Treated disrespectfully, and no follow up for my pain
body:
I called my practice for a call with the doctor after a hospital admission via ambulance for acute abdominal pain which is a new medical condition I have been suffering from recently.  
On receiving the telephone consultation with the doctor, I was met with a disrespectful tone and manner and no continuation of treatment for the pain I am still having almost fortnightly. This has resulted in me having to call NHS 24 again unfortunately after having another episode of this severe pain.  
I was then told by the doctor that another doctor (whom I have never heard of) would call me the following Monday but I received no follow up call on the Monday as advised.  
I really felt the doctor's attitude during the phone call did not live up to the NHS Values treating patients with ‚Äúdignity‚Äú and ‚Äúrespect‚Äú and in fact found it to be the complete opposite which made me feel disappointed and as though I will just have to live with this pain which has now gone from acute to chronic.  
After discussing my experience with my family we felt it was important to post this experience on Care Opinion to voice our concerns as this service really fell short of what I would expect from a GP who should be putting the patient at the heart of what they do rather than to basically ridicule them with a condescending and patronising tone and no further investigation/treatment for something so serious.  
I know that another bout of this severe abdominal pain will result in another ambulance admission and it is only a matter of time when our NHS emergency services are already under so much pressure which I feel guilty about but feel I have no other alternative as I have had no pain management or advice from my GP at all.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: browserfh56
title: Mental Health appointments
body:
The Mental Health team keep sending me appointments via written letter, which due to being away from home for periods of time I have missed,  
I have asked several times for my appointments to be emailed to me or sent via text messages, like other services within the NHS do, but have been told that this particular service is not set up to be able to do this. Why?  
I find it very ironic that a service that claims to care about the wellbeing and mental health of younger people do not use these modern means to contact us.  
Also, when I have missed my appointments, I feel that I am judged, which then affects my mental health making me feel bad and guilt tripped and reluctant to seek further help or appointments.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: composercs33
title: Looks like an air raid shelter
body:
Due to Sepsis I had to be admitted to hospital to have half of my right foot amputated. The hospital well it was so depressing, I can see they are renovating, and I think it will be nice when it‚Äôs finished but where I was well it looked like an air raid shelter.  
The surgery was good but the aftercare and I am not blaming the nurses they are working 17 hour long shifts but quite honestly they couldn‚Äôt do their jobs properly and I have no idea how they remained so cheerful.  
There was only 3 commodes for 27 beds.  
I had 2 ripple beds both which leaked, and the pillows were like pancakes. The equipment needed just wasn‚Äôt there. I am not blaming the nurses they are doing a difficult job under extreme circumstances, and I have nothing but admiration for them however I had to have a catheter fitted as I was retaining fluid but this came out. I was told it would just be for 24 hours but ended up with it fitted for 6 days and I have had problems in that area since.  
When I asked to go to the toilet I was told I had to be accompanied but a nurse wouldn‚Äôt be available for 30 minutes by which time I was too desperate and needed the commode. There is far too much to do for the amount of nursing staff.  
Two physiotherapists came to see me and insisted that I walked some steps but my dressing was tight and it was very painful, I told them this but they insisted and I felt bullied. I asked if they had been through a trauma like myself to which they replied no, and I told them not to judge me until they had.  
The day before I was due to go home there was a mix-up too. A nurse decided that I hadn‚Äôt been out of my bed that day and that I needed to show that I could walk before being allowed to go home. They insisted that I put my feet up. But I had been out if bed that day, twice I had a slow walk down the very very depressing corridor to where there was the only bit of natural light, but I did as the nurse asked. I felt so weak and felt like they didn't believe me and I was so upset that I burst out crying. Other staff came over and were very nice to me then.  
Overall, the care since I came home (into respite) at Fernbank has been absolutely fantastic. The night before I was due home they sent someone to stay the night with me and I cannot fault them. Three times a week the nurse visits me and nothing is too much trouble for them. I highly recommend them.  
All in all I feel the poor nurses have to much to do and deserve a pay rise.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: empathy85
title: Excellent care at emergency department let down by a patronising doctor
body:
I visited Altnagelvin's A&E dept last weekend due to a prolonged episode of SVT (fast heart rhythm). After being unable to calm it myself after 15 mins and my heart rate still over 170 bpm I made my way to the hospital (as advised to do by my own GP). I had taken one of my prescribed tablets to help stop the SVT episode and it had not worked either.  
After reporting to reception I was sent straight through to A&E and was quickly hooked up to an ECG where the staff were able to see my SVT in action. The SVT soon corrected itself after this (lasted approximately 35/40mins in all).  
I was then taken round to resus and hooked up to a heart monitor and had bloods taken and was told I would be getting a chest x-ray. I cannot fault the reception staff or the nurses and doctors up until now - they were amazing - so attentive and caring. I obviously was stressed and anxious but they all made me feel at ease and I felt well cared for.  
After an hour a senior doctor appeared (unfortunately I cannot remember their name) and abruptly told me I could go. I said ok and asked were my blood results clear and they told me they weren't back but they were sure they would be ok. I was a little unnerved by this as I would have expected these to be checked before leaving but assumed they would not send me home unless they were certain.  
I mentioned that the other doctors had said about an x-ray to which the doctor responded that I wouldn't need one. They then told me they would give me a minute to unhook myself from the heart monitor. I was shocked. The heart monitor had patches all over my chest and abdomen and leads. I also had a blood pressure cuff still attached. They were leaving me to unhook and disconnect everything myself.  
At that moment I felt like a hindrance. I had not asked to be moved there and I was more than happy to leave but their manner was so unprofessional and demeaning. I was incredibly sad leaving the hospital after what had been an excellent experience until I met this doctor.  
I advised the doctor I was currently waiting for a cardiology appt after previous prolonged SVT episodes. These have become more frequent in the last month, so naturally I am concerned if there is an underlying reason or cause.  
The doctor told me if I get an episode to pop a pill and relax on the sofa until it stops. Not quite what it advises on the NHS's own website.  
I do not make complaints normally, but this doctor's manner was patronising and left me feeling hurt and angry. I appreciate the NHS are under huge pressure and stresses. The other staff I met were all lovely.  
If the bed was needed I had no issue vacating it and waiting in the reception area until my bloods were back - not to be made to feel stupid.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: irishhaze36
title: Attending a Gynae Oncology clinic as a patient
body:
I was advised in the appointment letter that it was a teaching hospital and that medical students or trainee doctors may be in attendance. Also that if I was not comfortable with their presence I would have the opportunity to discuss this with the medical staff.  
At the appointment I was shown into a room with 3 people present and the lady who was the Consultant introduced me to a young man and a young girl as a student and a registrar.  
At that point I thought it would not be polite to say I wasn't comfortable with their presence as they were right there!  
When I went to the screened examination area an older nurse was very kind and tried to reassure me about the imminent intimate examination.  
At that point I thought that the Consultant would be doing the examination and internal scan of the uterus but it was the young man and not the Consultant. I was not consulted about this. I was distraught but didn't speak. It then became a teaching exercise with the Consultant advising the young man as to how to do the examination.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great care
body: We came for our appointment and were greeted by 2 smiling receptionists which was nice. Our doctor listened to the problems empathetically and really took the time to answer all our questions and explain the medications, why they were prescribed and what they did. We walked in feeling apprehensive but walked out feeling like a weight had been lifted. A big thank you to our GP and the team. A great experience.

title: Atrocious telephone service
body: I am extremely disappointed that as a group of 3 practices you have one telephone number which isn't answered.  I have tried to contact the practice for the past week, numerous times every day.  From a position of 21 in the call queue, i got disconnected at 30 minutes on Monday when i had got to position 9 on one occasion and on the remainder of the days the call was disconnected after 15 minutes.  I think this needs reviewing seriously.

title: Excellent service
body: Our 9 month old twins attended the paediatric ophthalmology outpatient clinic and the service was excellent. A very well run clinic and thorough assessment. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Helpful staff
body:
I called into the Surgery as I needed access to what injections I have had as I was due my medical for the police. Usually you get the answer you have to go online, you have to make an appointment, you have to send and email. I explained the situation to the member of staff on the reception in which rather than fobbing me off which mostly does happen or shall I say used to happen, this member of staff went out of her way to help me there and then. It was really important for me to have the dates as I was on a strict deadline.

I wanted to thank her for this and tell you all your doing an amazing job! Please do keep up the service levels, I know its not always easy as you have to see people with problems on a daily basis but I wanted to recognise you all for good service as I noticed a change in the surgery!

title: Impossible to see a doctor
body: I have been a patient at this practice for over 30 years. It has never been so difficult to actually see a doctor face to face. Booking an appointment is via submitted on line form which is triaged and they have a 2 day grace to respond. Often a text or telephone call from the fantastic nurses is the response. What has happened to the CARE of the doctors at this practice?

title: Excellent hospital
body: My daughter went in for her second elective surgery on the 19th of February. I want to thank everyone at Gate 46 children's Day surgery ward for their absolutely amazing care and kindness. Everyone including the anaesthetist, surgeon, nurses and HCA's made us feel welcome and kept both me and my daughter informed about the procedure which went very well. Thank you again to everyone!

author: Mooksmum
title: Absolute lifesavers
body:
Called breathing space after becoming so overwhelmed with feelings due to complex trauma. The call handler Claire, was calm, patient and understanding. She accepted me as I was and slowly chatted with me to help me see that my feelings were normal. She carried out a grounding technique with me that not only calmed me, but helped me sleep (something I hardly ever do).  
Before speaking to breathing space I had absolutely no hope that things would get better. Now I know that they will, and I know if things become too much again I only need to pick up the phone. Absolute lifesavers üíó

title: GREAT PRACTICE
body:
I was quite ill last year in out of bolton medical centre for check ups and blood tests etc, the reception and nurses were amazing all throughout and managed to help with everything going on weather it was over the phone or in the medical centre itself.

All I would say is that it would be good if doctors  would start seeing patients as sometimes a person needs to talk to a doctor face to face and over the phone the doctor can not understand a patients concern or matter.

title: Awful receptionists & ok doctors
body:
I am perplexed by the positive reviews regarding any of the receptionists as on the occasions I have visited the GP surgery in the past 23 years I have never once met a helpful, understanding or polite receptionist. To say they are rude is an understatement. The issues have been raised to doctors and staff and nothing has ever changed. 
Some of the GPs I‚Äôve encountered are friendly and helpful, however some are not and it‚Äôs clear their main aim is to tick you off the list and get you out of there. 
I‚Äôd highly suggest opting for a different GP centre if possible but if not, the doctors are ok as long as you can get past the battle axes on reception who seem to purposefully make your call or visit unpleasant and difficult.

title: Great practice
body: Looked after by all the staff involved with my treatment They could not have been any more helpful and assuring than they were they were all excellent

title: Thank you
body: Sorry, I wasn‚Äôt sure which department to select as endoscopy wasn‚Äôt on the list. I had to have an endoscopy which I was nervous about. I feel compelled to leave a review because the experience was so good (or as good as it can be when a camera is down your throat). Every person I encountered was kind and supportive. All of the people who were going to be in the room during the procedure introduced themselves and were warm, kind, clear about what was about to happen and reassuring. The procedure itself was handled in such a respectful way, updating and reassuring me throughout. I felt really looked after and really supported. After the procedure they talked me through the findings in a really clear way. I felt really reassured but also without any question left unanswered. I wouldn‚Äôt normally proactively leave a review like this but it‚Äôs really important to me that the staff know how great they are and what a difference their treatment meant to me. If this was a trip advisor review I‚Äôd leave 5 stars and say I‚Äôd be coming back but hopefully the care of the staff will mean I won‚Äôt have to! Thank you so much.

author: Jengt68
title: Colposcopy
body:
I needed further investigation of my cervix as I had abnormal cells on my routine cervical screening.  
I hate going for my cervical screenings and I am a really nervous person. But I felt really welcomed and the team did really well at putting me at ease.  
There was a male doctor, two nurses and a male student. One recommendation I have is that it would be nice to have a warning that male staff will be present, before the procedure. In saying this, however, it wasn‚Äôt a negative experience at all. In fact, the staff were very respectful and put me at ease. I think I just needed to prepare myself for it mentally beforehand, and I think others may feel the same. If it could be mentioned or put in literature that male staff might be present, I think patients would be more prepared mentally.  
Mr.Flood, Jen and Marie were very good and clear about every step of the way. I had time to get ready and was given a sheet to help me feel more comfortable and cover myself up. They help you get into positioning etc. and keep you chatting to keep your mind off what‚Äôs happening.  
The doctor looks under the microscope and checks the cervix. If there is something there, they will take a biopsy. You cough a few times while they do that. I didn‚Äôt feel much but it might be uncomfortable for others.  
They were very clear on next steps, timescales (so you know if you need to chase), and what to expect.

links.id: but put at ease by staff

title: Great Doctor and the team.
body: I visited RUH A&E on 20/02/2022 to get a treatment for unexpected appearance of hundreds of blisters on my my palms, feet and soles. It was a very stressful and depressed state of mind for me for few days. But, all sorted by the doctor who visited and treated me. Thank you doctor. You were very kind, very gentle and more than anything very professional. Thanks for making my mental and physical health fit and clear. Many thanks A&E RUH Bath.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

author: charapg73
title: Children's Ward
body:
My 2 year old visited for exposure testing for a possible nut allergy. The staff were incredible. My son was particularly fond of the play leader who was fantastic and made the visit lots of fun. We were on the ward for about four hours but they flew past, as my child was so well cared for and entertained. He is desperate to visit again.  
Thank you.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

title: Cortisone Injection
body:
Totally painless injection into my left shoulder. Very knowledgable, professional staff.
Was put at ease and felt comfortable with the full experience.

title: Fantastically brilliant practice
body:
From the very first contact with the receptionist through to a number of interactions with various members of staff, culminating in a discussion with the doctor I was treated in an exemplary fashion. Fortunately due to the care and consideration I was given I was able to find a solution to my problem and most importantly have been given the recognition that I know my own body and thus the on going opportunity to make decisions under the guidance of professionals. 
Thank you to all the staff at Pulborough medical group for their outstanding care and support.

title: Terrible
body: Terrible practice....been ill since Thursday...had to call 111.... phoned the practice on Thursday morning...told them possible kidney stones.. two hours before a doctor called back..then told to leave a urine sample at the reception...no results..no call back...no appointment offered...... I could have been hospitalised and they wouldn't have cared....

title: Good service
body: I sent an e-consult and was contacted the following day and an appointment was made for the same day.  Happy with the service.  I have dealt with the surgery many times on behalf of my elderly parents and found all of the staff helpful. Telephone queues are sometimes long but this is due to the current situation and lack of staff so you have to make allowances.  Overall service is good.

author: indigoeb93
title: My Dad
body:
My Dad has had pain in both his hips for a couple years.  
He had an X-ray in 2021 and was told that he had osteoarthritis in both hips. He has been on the urgent list since August 2021.  
The consultant told my Dad that his hips were in a bad way, but that the waiting list was up to 6 months. He was told that he had a (ttg) date of before Christmas 2021. It is now February 2022 and no op.
